basics.name: Wendy Huang
basics.label: Shidler Undergraduate Student
basics.summary: Hello, my name is Wendy! I am currently an undergraduate student at the University of Hawaii at Manoa's Shidler College of Business studying for a B.B.A. in Management Information Systems, Marketing, and Management. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025. After graduation, I hope to pursue a career that intersects with business and technology.

education.area: Marketing, Management Information Systems, and Management (expected Spring, 2025)

work.summary: My role as an Employment Services Assistant at the University of Hawaii at Manoa encompasses a range of responsibilities, from facilitating HR functions to delivering top-notch customer service and supporting students in accessing essential resources. I am passionate about contributing to the university community's growth and success.
highlights: Offer clear and comprehensive instructions to users of the student employment system, ensuring seamless navigation
Facilitate user understanding and proficiency through step-by-step guidance and support
Execute advanced clerical tasks with precision, maintaining a high standard of office organization and efficiency
Provide exceptional customer service, creating a welcoming and helpful atmosphere for office visitors
Manage onboarding processes for student employees, processing 20+ I-9 forms weekly
Responsively handle a high volume of 50+ daily emails, addressing inquiries and providing solutions
Provide valuable assistance to 50+ students weekly, addressing their unique needs
Streamline student support with efficient scheduling of 10+ career counseling appointments daily
Serve as a valuable resource by sharing pertinent information about various departmental programs and services
Enhance departmental transparency and user awareness through informative interactions
Manage scheduling operations, ensuring efficient coordination of workshops and career counseling sessions
Streamline appointment processes to optimize resource allocation and customer satisfaction

work.summary: Demonstrate excellent customer service including greeting customers, making product recommendations, answering client questions
highlights: Exemplify exceptional customer service by warmly welcoming and assisting patrons, offering insightful product recommendations, and addressing client inquiries, ensuring a memorable shopping experience
Execute precise financial transactions with a sharp eye for detail, swiftly resolving customer inquiries to ensure their financial needs are met with ease and satisfaction
Skillfully manage and meticulously track product inventory, guaranteeing accurate stock levels, and enabling efficient restocking processes
Play a pivotal role in maintaining the store's pristine cleanliness, contributing to an inviting shopping environment
Collaborate in seasonal layout transformations and product reorganization, enhancing store aesthetics and optimizing customer navigation
Spearheaded a substantial 80% improvement in email receipt rates, amplifying the store's digital engagement and communication with customers

Held the distinguished title of the #1 part-time seller within our district, spanning Hawaii, Guam, and other Pacific islands, consistently delivering exceptional sales performance that set the benchmark for   excellence
Instrumental in driving a remarkable 20% increase in in-store sales, consistently achieving daily sales figures of up to $5,000

extracurriculars.summary: Founded in 1998, the Business Executive Society of Tomorrow (BEST) is a general business club at the University of Hawaii at Manoa’s Shidler College of Business. With a member cap of 60, BEST has a proud history of maintaining and perpetuating excellence in its members. Through a combination of tours, workshops, networking events, alumni events, community services, and socials, the club strives to mold its members into well-rounded individuals
highlights: Actively participated in the Fall 2023 cohort by attending general meetings, engaging in workshops, and joining informative tours, enhancing my understanding of future business trends and leadership skills

extracurriculars.summary: The Center for Tomorrow’s Leaders is a local non-profit organization with a mission to engage, equip, and empower young leaders for Hawaiʻi. Through signature high school and post-secondary programs, CTL is creating an atmosphere for student leaders from every community to be discovered and trained. Our 10-year leadership pipeline for Hawai'i from sophomore year of high school to age 25 provides a leader feeder for Hawai'i’s businesses, government, and all sectors of young people who are from, for, and in Hawai'i
highlights: Led and managed a student team to support the After School All Stars program at Ke'elikolani Middle School, focusing on providing valuable extracurricular activities and mentorship to local students

extracurriculars.summary: Our mission is to strengthen the social and professional network between members of the Information Technology Management Association, alumni, and professionals by focusing on the development of quality relationships. ITMA is motivated and dedicated to provide its members with social and professional relationships, provide access to technical resources, and be an example of a growing technical environment to foster career development
highlights: Became a member in Fall 2023 and actively participated by attending general meetings and engaging with industry professionals, gaining insights and connections within the field of IT and technology

extracurriculars.summary: A`ALI`I Mentoring is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization in Hawaii that helps young adults from underserved communities navigate and persevere in higher education. Many young people from communities underrepresented in higher education face the typical challenges related to the transition to college and also daunting difficulties including academic, financial, familial, and personal hardships. They may not be aware of or have access to financial, educational, and career resources and opportunities. As a result, many young people do not achieve their higher education

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: The Dean’s List recognizes students with a superior academic record, i.e., a minimum current grade point average of 3.5 for 12 or more credits of academic coursework.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: TRIO Manoa Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to students in the TRIO program at UH Manoa in recognition of their academic excellence.

awards.title: Sophomore Merit Scholarship
awards.awarder: University of Hawaii at Manoa Outreach College
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to up to 30 sophomore UH Manoa students in recognition of their academic excellence.
